material.mattext: Based on the p-value, which of the following conclusions can be made?
The data provides significant evidence that the average number of miles driven per year is less than 12,000.
The data does not provide significant evidence that the average number of miles driven per year is less than 12,000.
The data provides significant evidence that the average number of miles driven per year is 12,000.
The data provides significant evidence that the alternative hypothesis is more likely than the null hypothesis.
Incorrect. Note that the p-value is more than 0.05. Please try again.

Correct. Since the p-value is > 0.05 (alpha), we cannot accept the alternative hypothesis. We could have also stated that we do not reject the null hypothesis (that the data does not provide significant evidence to reject that the average number of miles driven per year is 12,000).
Incorrect. Recall that we never accept the null hypothesis; we would not reject it instead. Please try again.

Incorrect. It should be noted that the statement that you chose is actually statistically inaccurate. Note that the number of miles driven per year is a parameter (µ), and therefore a fixed, unknown quantity about which we are making inferences. We can talk about the probability that a random variable takes a certain value(s), but not that a fixed quantity does. Please try again.
